references.paper_title: Deploying and evaluating LLMs to program service mobile robots
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the core problem of the current work, focusing on the performance gap between proprietary and open-weight LLMs in generating robot programs.

references.paper_title: Evaluating large language models trained on code
references.reason: This paper provides a benchmark for evaluating LLMs on code generation tasks, which is relevant to the current work's focus on evaluating LLMs for generating robot programs.

references.paper_title: Self-Instruct: Aligning language model with self generated instructions
references.reason: This paper introduces the SELF-INSTRUCT method, which is a crucial component of the proposed ROBO-INSTRUCT framework.

references.paper_title: Code Llama: Open foundation models for code
references.reason: This paper introduces the CodeLlama model, which is the base model used in the experiments of the current work.

references.paper_title: Chain of thought prompting elicits reasoning in large language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the chain-of-thought prompting method, which is used in the INSTALIGN component of the proposed ROBO-INSTRUCT framework.
